intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: King Garon, it appears as though the Hoshidans have crossed Mount Garou.

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: I am aware of that. It seems your trick with the explosives may be growing stale. Running out of ideas, are we?

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: My apologies, Your Majesty. I take full responsibility for this misstep. However, I assure you that I have more tricks up my sleeve. I'll redeem myself—you'll see!

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: I certainly hope so.

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: Yes...er...of course. I plan on ambushing Corrin and his/her troops shortly.

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: Do as you wish. But understand that this is the last failure I will tolerate.

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: Certainly, Your Majesty.

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: Pitiful.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Finally...some sign of civilization. Even though this place looks deserted.

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Yes. I believe this place is known as Macarath. It's a town known for stage shows and gambling, much like Nestra. However, it seems as though the war has put a damper on business.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: That's just as well. We don't have any time to waste. We should probably keep to the outskirts as much as possible.

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Agreed.

intro.speaker: Takumi
intro.line: *cough* *cough*

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Takumi? Are you feeling OK?

intro.speaker: Takumi
intro.line: Urgh... Yes, everything's fine...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: You don't seem very steady on your feet. Perhaps we should rest.

intro.speaker: Takumi
intro.line: No, really, I'm fine. *cough* *cough* Hurrrk...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Takumi! Can you hear me?! Someone, help!

intro.speaker: Sakura
intro.line: Oh no...how is this possible?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: What is it, Sakura? What's wrong with him?

intro.speaker: Sakura
intro.line: I...I think he has a rare fever that's specific to this region. Do you see these spots on his throat? They're one of the unique symptoms. It's extremely s-serious! He could die if we don't treat it immediately.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Gods... How could this have happened?

intro.speaker: Sakura
intro.line: It's possible he contracted it from one of the wolfskin. They're known scavengers...and carrion is loaded with icky germs. I'm s-sorry. I should've noticed his symptoms a lot earlier.

intro.speaker: Takumi
intro.line: *cough* *cough* Don't worry, Sakura. It's not what you think it is. It'll probably just go away on its own. Or...maybe Azura can try singing for me! Didn't that work before?

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: I'm sorry, Takumi, but my song isn't a miracle cure. It won't help with this.

intro.speaker: Takumi
intro.line: Oh...now you tell me.

intro.speaker: Sakura
intro.line: If I remember correctly, there's and herb that can reduce the fever considerably. But I have no idea where to find any.

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Hmm... The Palace Macarath should have a well-stocked apothecary.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: But if it's a Nohrian palace, won't it be filled with...you know...Nohrians?

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Yes, of course. However, I notice we haven't seen many people around so far. I think it's reasonable to assume the palace will not be fully staffed. Especially when King Garon isn't around.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Well, I can't think of a better idea. Let's check it out.

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Very well. Follow me. My intelligence reports are highly detailed.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Will you be able to walk, Takumi?

intro.speaker: Takumi
intro.line: Nnngh. Yes, as short way at least. Just put my bow in my hand if we run into any Nohrian scum. Even in this state, I'll take a few of 'em out with me.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: So this is one of Garon's palaces. It does seem oddly deserted.

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: We've been lucky so far. Garon wouldn't leave the place completely abandoned. We should remain on high alert.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Understood. Is everyone ready?

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Yes. Now, let's not dwadle as we enter the palace. There may be roving guards. Let's move one three. One...two... Three!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Come on, everyone!
Intruders? Show yourselves!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: It looks like we have company. Brace yourselves and be ready for anything. Garon could have left a monster waiting for us. Or a trap. Or...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: ...Flora?!

intro.speaker: Flora
intro.line: Lord/Lady Corrin?

intro.speaker: Jakob
intro.line: What are you doing here?!

intro.speaker: Felicia
intro.line: Sister!

intro.speaker: Flora
intro.line: Why are all of YOU here? This is super dangerous! There's an unused room nearby—let's get out of here and talk.

intro.speaker: Flora
intro.line: All right. We should be safe here for a while. It's so good to see you again, Lord/Lady Corrin!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: You too, Flora. I miss everyone from Nohr. Except King Garon, of course. Anyway, what are you doing here?

intro.speaker: Flora
intro.line: After you left, everyone in the Northern Fortress was sent away. I got my orders to come here, and that was it.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I'm so sorry. I know my decision impacted a lot of people.

intro.speaker: Flora
intro.line: It's OK. I'm actually happy to be here. Your decision really opened my eyes to what was going on. Now I'm just glad I don't have to see King Garon every day...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I see. I'm glad to hear it, Flora.

intro.speaker: Flora
intro.line: So...how did the rest of you end up here?

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: I'm sorry, but it's a long story, and right now we need medicine for my brother. Can you help us?

intro.speaker: Flora
intro.line: Yes, of course. Nobody works at the apothecary anymore, but it's fully stocked. I'm sure I can sneak out whatever you need.

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: You'd do that for us?

intro.speaker: Flora
intro.line: Of course! Any friend of Lord/Lady Corrin's is a friend of mine. After I get the medicine, I'll show you how to sneak out the back door of the palace.

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Thank you, Flora. You may be saving my brother's life.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Iago!

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: Hello, Corrin. Happy to see me again?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: What do you want? You're massively outnumbered here.

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: Oh ho! So quickly you begin speaking of battle. Where's the witty banter? One mustn't leap straight into battle without a little banter. It's uncivilized! Also, as usual, you're badly misinformed. You're the one who's outnumbered.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: How did you know we were here? Were you the one who attacked the hideout in Cheve?

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: Oh, I'd love to take credit for that, but I'm afraid it belongs to one of your friends.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: What are you saying?

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: Ah, dearest Flora. I didn't realize you were here. Kicked out of Garon's inner circle, were you?

intro.speaker: Flora
intro.line: I don't have anything to say to you.

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: Ooh, saucy! I like it. Maybe I'll kill you last.

intro.speaker: Flora
intro.line: Iago, I'm ordering you to leave at once! I am an official employee of this palace, and you are NOT. Remember, this is King Garon's royal villa. What would he say about you destroying it with a battle?

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: Oh, you're so wrong. I can do anything, as long as I get results.

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: Like this—see?

intro.speaker: Flora
intro.line: Eyaaaahh!

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: That's for talking back. Now, who's next? You'll all bend the knee before I'm finished.

intro.speaker: Flora
intro.line: Lord/Lady Corrin...RUN!

intro.speaker: Flora
intro.line: Urgh...

intro.speaker: Felicia
intro.line: No! Flora!

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: She's just taking a little nap. Now. I'm feeling all bantered out. Let's get down to business.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: You'll pay for this, Iago.

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: Wonderful. A pithy final statement from our hero. Unfortunately this is no fairy tale, Prince/Princess Corrin. King Garon would like your head on a platter, and I'm not one to disappoint him.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: How's this for pithy? GET HIM!

boss.speaker: Iago
boss.line: Pfft. What do you think you're doing, minion? Bring on Corrin!

boss.speaker: Iago
boss.line: And here we are, at last. I've been waiting for you.

boss.speaker: Corrin
boss.line: I'm done talking. It's time to finish this.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: This is it, Iago. Now, I just need to know one thing. Answer truthfully, and I'll be merciful. Who told you that we were here?

end.speaker: Iago
end.line: *cough* *cough* Heh...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I assure you, you have nothing to laugh about. Tell me now! Or else...

end.speaker: Iago
end.line: Or else you'll have to doubt your own people. Right?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: What?!

end.speaker: Iago
end.line: You, betrayer of Nohr, are now being betrayed yourself. Now, I think I'd like to savor the irony just a while longer, so... Good-bye!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: How can he just...disappear...like that?

end.speaker: Iago
end.line: When will you learn, young prince/princess? You think that was really me? I almost feel bad for you. From this moment on, you'll never be able to let your guard down. Who will be the first to stab you in the back? Who can you really trust?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Shut up...

end.speaker: Iago
end.line: Very well, Corrin... Good luck.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Ugh...

end.speaker: Flora
end.line: Ungh...hrm...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Flora, are you all right?

end.speaker: Flora
end.line: Uh...yeah. I think so. What happened to Iago?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: He's gone. We had him for a second there, but then he slipped away. In any case, he can't hurt you anymore.

end.speaker: Flora
end.line: Oh, thank goodness.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Unfortunately, he left us with some rather troubling words. He implied there's another traitor among us.

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: Come on, Corrin! Do you really believe that? He's just trying to mess with your head.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: You're probably right. But I have to admit...I do feel a bit uneasy.

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: That's not like you at all. You usually trust everybody!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I know, but it's just that...

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: *huff* *huff* *huff*

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: No! Is your fever coming on stronger?

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: I feel so...sluggish...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Takumi!

end.speaker: Sakura
end.line: Oh, this isn't good—his fever is s-spiking. We really need that medicine!

end.speaker: Flora
end.line: All right, now that Iago's gone, I should be able to get into the apothecary. But...I still don't know what I'm looking for.

end.speaker: Sakura
end.line: O-of course. I'll come with you. Let's go!

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: Zzz... Zzz...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: It looks like he's sleeping soundly. So the medicine must have worked.

end.speaker: Sakura
end.line: Y-yes. He should be fine now. He just needs plenty of rest.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Thank you, Sakura.

end.speaker: Flora
end.line: Yay! Oh, I'm glad he's doing better.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Yes, thank you for your help, Flora. I hate to think about what could have happened if you hadn't been here.

end.speaker: Flora
end.line: Please, don't mention it. So...what are you going to do now, Lord/Lady Corrin? Iago knows exactly where you are...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Yes, that's true. But I think we have to stick to the original plan and head to the capital.

end.speaker: Flora
end.line: Oh...I see. I guess I was kind of hoping that you'd stop by my village first.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Really? Why?

end.speaker: Flora
end.line: To be honest, I don't feel safe here anymore. I want to go home! But it makes sense for you, too. The Ice Tribe village isn't controlled by Nohr. You could take shelter there and plan your next move. And Takumi could get some much-needed rest.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: But what if King Garon finds out that your village is cooperating with us? Aren't you worried about what could happen?

end.speaker: Felicia
end.line: I think the village will be all right. It's full of strong warriors! If soldiers were to invade, the villagers would simply freeze them in place!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Heh, I guess that's true.

end.speaker: Felicia
end.line: Ooh, this is exciting! I've always wanted to show you my home village, Lord/Lady Corrin. Remember how we used to dream about this, Flora?

end.speaker: Flora
end.line: Yes. Yes, we did...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Very well. This should throw the Nohrian army off our track, at least for a while. Thank you for the offer, Flora.

end.speaker: Flora
end.line: Of course! It's my pleasure.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Let's give Takumi a few more minutes to rest and then get moving.

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: Zzz... Zzz... Ungh... Be careful...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Takumi? What do you mean?

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: Brother/Sister...something's not right... Look behind the curtain... Ughhh...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: He's delirious! Did that make sense to anyone else?

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: Zzz... Zzz...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: That must be some fever dream he's having...

end.speaker: Sakura
end.line: I-I don't know, Corrin. He sounded lucid for a second there...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Yes. I suppose he did...
